intro: Drimia physodes, commonly known as the Cape daffodil, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces a tall flowering stem that bears several blooms, making it a popular ornamental plant. Drimia physodes is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
